block_comment: This line of code performs a bit shift operation in a shift register. It specifically assigns the bit from the eighth (index 7) position of the 'ShiftReg' shift register to the variable 'ShiftedBit'. Bit shifting operations are typically used in digital systems for functions such as division or multiplication by powers of two, or for circular shift operations, all of which can be implemented efficiently in hardware. The implementation here is pretty straightforward, simply directly assigning the value from a specific index in an array to the output variable.
